channel.title: mySQL?
channel.description:
Not sure if this is the right sec, because I'm from Mopar, but I was wondering.
I'm thinking of using SQL integration on my website. I have the money to buy SQL, but is it really worth it?
============================================================ Thank you Niall for moving this into the right section!!!

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:16, topic:245305”]MySQL rocks, and it’s free. My site’s using it, I suggest getting it.
It’s not DIFFICULT to learn, more or less confusing.[/quote]

I can’t seem to quite grasp the fact that you can afford a domain that redirects to a free piece of shit hosting site? Nothing against your site though.

http://www.rubsca.com
http://www.rubiksscape.smfforfree2.com

???

Read full topic

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

MySQL rocks, and it’s free. My site’s using it, I suggest getting it.
It’s not DIFFICULT to learn, more or less confusing.

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote="~IMxoxoxIM~, post:3, topic:245305"][quote author=Niall link=topic=321732.msg2544168#msg2544168 date=1227157024]
MySQL is free, so is PostgreSQL.
[/quote]
Free?

I was told Sql was a free TRIAL, yet had to be paid for?[/quote]

I was confused at first too, I thought you had to pay for MySQL but they really wanna make you think that ( I think ) When you go to mysql.com the first link is free 30 day trial which may be deceiving. But, it really is free except for enterprise.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 22, 2008, 09:01:50 pm[/size][hr]Look under community server

http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/5.0.html#downloads

Read full topic

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

put it this way… for what you want to do you only need the box standard mysql which is free and since im guessing you want to make web apps all you need to do is go to is go to this url www.wampserver.com/dl.php and install that… it will run your php and mysql

Read full topic

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

if you are a student you can get mySQL server 2008 free, along with lots of other cool Microsoft stuff

https://www.dreamspark.com/

Read full topic

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:9, topic:245305”]Enterprise offers support and platform specific binaries.[/quote]I don’t think you really need to worry about that much though.

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:245305”]Just to point out, MySQL Enterprise is not free (and never has been), which is what you may be looking at on the website. You want MySQL Community.[/quote]What is the difference?

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Just to point out, MySQL Enterprise is not free (and never has been), which is what you may be looking at on the website. You want MySQL Community.

Read full topic

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

If you have to pay to have MySQL and its a hosting company don’t, unless they are providing MSSQL, then maybe but only if you know how to use it.

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

MySQL is TOTALY free… i think you might be looking at a server

to use MySQL just DL Wamp5 or xampp there php servers with MySQL that run locally so you can dev your scripts

item.title: mySQL?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:

[quote="~IMxoxoxIM~, post:3, topic:245305"][quote author=Niall link=topic=321732.msg2544168#msg2544168 date=1227157024]
MySQL is free, so is PostgreSQL.
[/quote]
Free?

I was told Sql was a free TRIAL, yet had to be paid for?[/quote]Like he said… MySQL and PostgreSQL are free, period.

I know for a fact, MySQL is open-source.
